definitions.definition: A homogeneous mass of rock, not layered and without an obvious crystal structure.
A group of people from a locality, or sharing a collective aim, interest, etc.
definitions.example: Big up to the Croydon massive!

definitions.definition: Very large in size or extent
definitions.example: Compared to its counterparts from World War II, the Abrams main battle tank is truly massive.

definitions.definition: Very large or bulky and heavy and solid
definitions.example: A massive comet or asteroid appears to have ended the era of the dinosaurs.

definitions.definition: To a very great extent; total, utter.
Of particularly exceptional quality or value; awesome.
definitions.example: Did you see Colbert last night? He was massive!
Your dress is massive, love. Where did you get it?

definitions.definition: Affecting a large portion of the body, or severe.

definitions.example: Some bosons are massive while others are massless.
